lexUnit.name: narrow-minded.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not willing to listen to or tolerate other people's views; prejudiced.

sentence.text: My husband 's family , although they are educated , -- one of my brothers-in-law is a barrister and another is an engineer -- they are still very narrow-minded about women .
Lord Tebbit tells me he has still to agree on his luxury -- ` the BBC seem to be rather narrow-minded about some of the luxuries I 'd thought of . "

To some all this will appear to be petty , intrusive and narrow-minded along the lines of ‘ What right had they to … ’ ; to others it will appear an example of the chapel 's commitment to their beliefs .
The refusal to join the ERM is harming the nation , as narrow-minded nationalism generally does .
Of course they 're going to find in Scripture the sexist views which conform to their own narrow-minded view of the world .
Seeing as you seem to have such a small and narrow-minded attitude , you will never have heard of them .
I am a Catholic and as opposed to the narrow-minded Catholics of America as Sinead .

Disciplinary frontiers should be channels of communication , not iron curtains of mutual unintelligibility and mistrust ; this regrettably narrow-minded approach misconstrues the complementary aims and interests of these cognate subjects .
Costs have got themselves a terrible name , mainly because narrow-minded finance people have concentrated on reducing them in an effort to increase profit .
Or he could start his own venue , impose his own narrow-minded door policy and see how few people turn up and how few bands agree to play .
Earlier in the day 's debate , Viscount Whitelaw , former Tory Deputy Prime Minister under Margaret Thatcher , accused treaty opponents of ` taking a narrow-minded view . "
A theatre-goer has congratulated Darlington Civic Theatre director Brian Goddard for his ` stand against the narrow-minded provincialism of Coun Jones " .
Donald was boring , sensationally incompetent at his job , complacent , vain , narcissistic , almost aggressively narrow-minded .
“ Church people were all too often narrow-minded , censorious , judgemental , intolerant , conventional … so the people for whom the world was too harsh would never think of turning to the Church …
She wished her father and mother were like other parents and not so narrow-minded .
His brothers seemed rather unimaginative and narrow-minded , although they were both well educated : they felt that anybody outside the Church or university could not be respected .

The excuse quoted by Mr Dick Palmer strikes me as being narrow-minded and insensitive , and to compare Manchester United and Arsenal football strips with the international logo for the Olympics is contemptible .
Frankly , I was quite pleased to leave the 11th , for all fighting was over , and a regular outfit is very boring and narrow-minded when not in action .
He was too narrow-minded and prejudiced -- and bigoted .
The ` established " genetic thinking and the ` established " neo-Darwinian thinking have been ` unnecessarily narrow-minded and complacent " ( how much would be necessary ? ) -- and so on and on .
British industrial operatives remained educationally backward , locked in primitive tribal attitudes and prey to narrow-minded and destructive trade union militancy .
It would be narrow-minded and bigoted not to welcome these convergent developments .
One should n't be narrow-minded when looking for a man 's weakness . "
